feed.title: Lightning, the death of BIP62, and Segregated Witness

entry.title: Lightning, the death of BIP62, and Segregated Witness
entry.summary: Tadge Dryja has written about BIP62, which addresses multiple vectors for txid malleability and 3rd party malleability. However, it does not help in the context of lightning channel creation because ECDSA sigs are inherently malleable. The needed functionality is to reliably spend from unconfirmed transactions. Segregated witness can accomplish that but it is a large hard-fork change. Sighash_noinput can also accomplish that, and it is not a hard fork change. It is generally difficult to come up with features that absolutely must be implemented as hard fork changes.
